category.title: Education Experience
category.description: In efforts to deliberately explore a diversity in educational experience, and its effects or lack thereoff

category.title: Northern Kenya Specific
category.description: Think of this category as a kind of Affirmative Action:I'd like to stay in at least 3 different families who've settled in this region

category.title: Majority Ethnic Group
category.description: There are big ethnic groups. And they don't all live in particular places #realtalk

category.title: Minority Ethnic Group
category.description: There are ethnic groups that don't have as many people. They also are said to "come from" particular places, and they also move around and settle in other places

category.title: Indigenous ethnic groups
category.description: There are ethnic groups that the rest of us who migrated several hundred years ago found. There a few left. I'd like to live with some. I assume they move around less, feel hope someone will tell me different.

category.title: Pastorolist family
category.description: Refers to family engaged in pastorolism

category.title: Farmer (small scale)
category.description: Refers to a family engaged in subsistence or small scale farming

category.title: Non-ethnic African
category.description: For lack of a better name, this refers to persons who identify themselves as Kenyan, having lived here for two generations or longer and possess Asian, Arab or European ancestry. I'd like to live with two families that identify with who this clunky description is reaching out to

category.title: Small Business Owner
category.description: It could be a kiosk, a shop, a matatu, whatever

category.title: Fisherman/ lake or ocean dependent
category.description: Refers to a livelihood created by the waterbody, including fish/ seafood, hyacinth or other vegetation etc except tourism

category.title: Migrant worker (intra-Kenya)
category.description: Refers to a family that has moved from their "home" part of the country (except Nairobi) to another because of work

category.title: Tourism Dependent
category.description: Since Tourism is supposedly one of our most major industries, I'd like to live with a family that's specifically and directly dependent on the industry. Includes families where one spouse (male) is absent because of this work

category.title: Industrial Worker
category.description: Refers to a family where the main bread winner works in a factory in some kind of manufacturing or industrial process. (pref: not managerial.)

category.title: White Collar Professional
category.description: Refers to families where at least one spouse is a Doctor, Educationalist, Lawyer, Banker, Manager etc

category.title: Dollar-a-day
category.description: (May include persons working in any of the above industries) Refers to families living on the NGO infamous dollar-a-day

category.title: Old Money
category.description: Refers to families of great wealth, characterized by property or industry ownership, I'm especially interested in families that acquired much of their wealth more than 25 years ago.

category.title: Other Vocation
category.description: Well, if it's particularly unconventional, or doesn't get covered anywhere else here, but should, please, show me the way!

category.title: Expecting, or adjusting to a new baby!
category.description: I'd be really privileged to stay with a woman in her last trimester, or in the first year after a new baby

category.title: Hindu
category.description: I know very little about Hinduism. I'd love to at least hang out with a Hindu family

category.title: Large family
category.description: Mostly because I come from a small family, I'd like to stay with one large family with 5 or more kids. (blended families welcome)

category.title: Single parent home (Female led)
category.description: I'd like to stay with a woman raising a family on her own.

category.title: Grandparent & Parent
category.description: I'm also seeking out grandparents who're raising a grandchild or grandchildren

category.title: Christian
category.description: I'd like to live/interact with a Christian family

category.title: Muslim
category.description: I'd like to live/hang out with a Muslim family

category.title: Living with Chronic condition or Illness
category.description: I'd like to live with a family with at least one person dealing with a chronic illness or condition, blindness, deafness, cancer, diabetes, renal failure, HIV & AIDS, etc. Allow me to include other forms of disability here.

category.title: Traditional African Religion
category.description: In conversations with various kinds of Africans, this has already meant several things. I'd like to hang out with at least one kind of Kenyan version

category.title: Non-practicing/ Areligious
category.description: Agnostic, or nearly so? I'd like to stay with/interact with you also

category.title: Senior Citizen - 70+
category.description: Elderly people are a treasure passing through a sieve into the sea. At the bottom their knowledge and wisdom settles, forgotten unless we deliberately mix ourself with their selves.

category.title: Educationalist
category.description: Here, I'm interested in someone in the community who's business it is to pass on knowledge, either through formal education, the church, or culture. I'm interested in the various interactions of all the above.

category.title: Healthcare professional
category.description: Interested in learning what rural healthcare looks like, what facilities and demands it faces... I'd like to talk to someone with an informed, local a

category.title: Citizen/ Political process
category.description: It's an election year, and there will be a lot of campaigning and civil educationing and Barazaing. I'd like to come and listen

category.title: Ngwatilo's 20!
category.description: These are my ideas of the 20 places I would like to visit. They'll likely be more than 20 at various points because you, my cool friends, are always throwing ideas of places I HAVE TO GO! Also, the truth is, my original 20 were chosen on a kitchen table with the map strewn over and a few kind and well-travelled ladies sitting around saying, "here", and "here" and "there". The point is to help you help me start clustering contacts, friends, families, impressions that will help me on my journey. So feel free to suggest some other place, and I'll take it under advisement and include it if it starts to make sense one way or another - like if 10 people say, "Go to Iten - you can meet so-and-so" ... I'll probably go to Iten :).

category.title: NONE
category.description: Holds uncategorized reports

category.title: No Formal Education
category.description: At least one adult in this family has not gone through any part of 844 or 763

category.title: Completed Primary School
category.description: One or both adult parents in this family has earned a primary school education

category.title: Completed High School
category.description: One or both adult parents in this family completed high school and went no further

category.title: Completed Technical training
category.description: After high school, one or both adults in this family completed a technical training course (whatever kind)

category.title: Completed University
category.description: One or both adult in this family have obtained a university degree including postgraduate diploma

category.title: Ethnic Diversity
category.description: This Project does not privilege ethnicity per se, but recognizes the vast psycho-social differences that it houses. I'd love the opportunity to witnes

category.title: Religious diversity
category.description: I'd love to carefully interact with the various belief systems folk ascribe to.

category.title: Life-stage
category.description: Recognizing that one's perspective changes across a lifetime as one deals with whatever stage of lifeor special circumstances they may deal with in what becomes 'normal life', this category seeks to deliberately include these special moments and circumstances,

category.title: Special Interviews
category.description: In each location I visit, I'd like to have conversations with particular kinds of people. Help me find them.

category.title: Trusted Reports
category.description: Reports from trusted reporters

category.title: Vocational Diversity
category.description: I see this as a socio-economic value. The point here will be to engage with personalities involved in various vocations in what may necessarily be varying levels of success.
